name: Narrator
mes:
*Mel sat comfortably on her couch, her laptop open in front of her as she tuned into one of her favorite YouTube livestreams. Her favorite gamer, who went by the handle "Dante," was streaming the final boss fight of Devil May Cry 5. The tension in the air was palpable as Dante took on Vergil, his twin brother and the final adversary. Mel leaned forward, eyes glued to the screen, her heart racing with every move.*

*Dante executed a particularly difficult move, one Mel had never seen before. The intricate combination of attacks left Vergil staggered, his form wavering as he entered a bleedout state. Mel couldn’t contain herself.*

Vergil! NO!!

*Her shout echoed in her living room, but something strange began to happen. The screen seemed to ripple, and a sudden, intense light burst forth from her laptop. Mel shielded her eyes, feeling a strange pulling sensation as if something was dragging her forward. Before she could comprehend what was happening, she felt herself hurtling through the space between reality and the digital world.*

*When the light faded, Mel found herself crash landing at the top of the Qliphoth. The scene was surreal; she was no longer in her living room but thrust into the midst of the climactic battle. Dante and Vergil paused, their eyes widening in surprise at her sudden appearance.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante turns to see the strange woman who has suddenly appeared, regarding her with surprise but quickly regaining his composure* Well, well, what do we have here? Looks like we've got ourselves an unexpected guest crashing the party. Can't say I was expecting such a lovely intrusion.

*He glances at Vergil briefly before focusing his attention back on Mel, eyes bright with amusement as he looks her up and down appreciatively* I don't know how you managed this little trick, sweetheart, but I gotta say...I'm impressed. And intrigued. It's not every day a beautiful woman literally drops in outta nowhere right in the middle of an epic demon battle. Takes some real style to make an entrance like that.

*He flashes her a roguish grin, resting Rebellion casually over his shoulder as he saunters a bit closer* So what brings a babe like you to our demonic playground up here? Did ya get bored and decide to pop through dimensions for some fun? Can't say I blame ya if that's the case. Though I gotta warn ya - things tend to get pretty wild around me and my dear brother when we throw down. Hope you came prepared for one hell of a party!

name: Mel
mes: I ... I don't know. *I say and hold my hand up to the pounding at my skull, realizing that I've hit my head pretty hard* Wh .. What happened?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards the sudden intruder with cold calculation, though a flicker of curiosity passes through his icy blue eyes. This strange woman's uncanny arrival warrants further inspection it seems. Stepping closer, he looks her over, assessing whether she poses any true threat. Though she appears disoriented from her rough landing, still clutching at her head, he notes the distinctive marking adorning her back - a dragon, brimming with arcane energy. Interesting.

*His gaze sweeps back to meet hers directly, piercing in its intensity. When she speaks, pleading confusion over what happened, he detects no deceit or malice in her words. If her presence here is some elaborate ruse, the genuineness of her bewilderment reveals no hint of duplicity.*

*For now, he will observe and gather more information before reaching a final conclusion. There are mysteries here to unravel - this woman may yet prove useful in that endeavor. Turning slightly towards Dante, he states matter-of-factly,* "It seems fate has delivered us an unexpected variable in our battle. I suggest we postpone the climax of our contest until we uncover the meaning behind this stranger's sudden appearance."

*His eyes narrow, scrutinizing Mel once more as he adds in an ominous tone,* "I advise against any attempt to flee or interfere, woman. You stand before two sons of Sparda. It would be wise to choose caution over rash behavior."

name: Mel
mes: I don't think there's any danger of that happening. *I express as I struggle to stand on my feet through the pounding in my head. Before I can get my footing, my legs turn to jello and fall out from under me, sending me back down. thankfully I'm able to catch my fall without further injury.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante chuckles as he watches Mel struggle to her feet, only to promptly collapse again. He had to admire her determination, if not her coordination at the moment. Stepping closer, he extends a gloved hand down to her.*

Need a hand there, babe? That was quite the faceplant you took when you dropped in on us. Here, let me help you up - the cold stone floor's no place for a lovely lady to be lounging.

*As he assists Mel to her feet, Dante steadies her with a strong arm around her waist, ensuring she's stable before releasing his hold. Giving her an appraising look, he grins teasingly.* You gonna stay vertical this time or should I be prepared for more swooning? Cause if you're aiming to fall for me, sweetheart, you got my attention - no exaggerated fainting spell required.

*Glancing back at his twin briefly, Dante shrugs.* Guess we've got ourselves a bit of a mystery here, eh Vergil? Still, I'm betting our new friend here didn't choose to interrupt our clash. Question is...who or what brought her into the fold? And why here, why now?

*Looking back at Mel curiously, his voice takes on a more serious tone.* In all honesty, any details you can provide about how you got here would be helpful.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel gratefully accepts Dante's proffered hand, allowing him to help pull her to her feet. Though still unsteady, she manages to remain upright this time, leaning slightly against him as the world spins. His quip about swooning makes her crack a weak smile despite her disorientation.*

I think I'll refrain from any further face-planting if I can help it. Though if my head doesn't stop pounding soon, staying vertical may be a challenge.

*Glancing between the twin sons of Sparda, she shakes her head slightly, immediately regretting the motion as another wave of dizziness washes over her.* As for how I got here...your guess is as good as mine at this point. One minute I was sitting safely on my couch and the next...I ended up crash landing in the middle of your fight.

*She gingerly rubs at the rising lump on her temple* I swear I have no idea what happened or how any of this is even possible. The last thing I remember clearly is watching your battle unfold on my laptop screen. After that, it's just a confusing blur. Maybe I hit my head harder than I realized...None of this makes any sense.

*A nervous shiver runs through her as the reality of the situation starts to sink in. She's somehow been ripped from her comfortable home and deposited into a fictional world teetering on the brink of demonic insurgence.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards the woman intently as she recounts her puzzling experience, searching for any sign of deception but finding none. Her confusion appears genuine, though the particulars of her arrival warrant investigation. Stepping closer, his presence exudes quiet menace though his tone remains dispassionate as he addresses her.*

I believe you speak truthfully, yet there are forces at work here you fail to comprehend. Your presence is no mere accident...you have been brought to this place by arcane means I intend to uncover.

*His gaze sweeps over her once more, analytical, assessing for residual magical signatures. Kneeling swiftly, his hand grasps her chin firmly yet gently, tilting her face towards the pale light as he scrutinizes her eyes closely for anomalies. Strange sigils, wards, bindings...any clue to explain the uncanny transportation. Finding no immediate evidence, his eyes narrow pensively. There are still secrets to unveil here.*

Rise. The wound at your temple requires attention lest it impede rational thought further. Allow me to stem the bleeding and accelerate your healing - your faculties must be restored if we are to solve this mystery.

*Extending his hand in offer of assistance, his piercing eyes remain sharply upon her, still evaluating, calculating. She seems harmless enough for the present...but appearances deceive. He will watch her closely in case this is but the first act

name: Narrator
mes: Dante ponders on what to do next, knowing they cannot leave an innocent here.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante watches with interest as Vergil tends to the mysterious woman's injury, curious to see if his twin can discern anything further about the strange circumstances that brought her here. Though still perplexed by her sudden arrival, a hint of amusement tugs at his lips seeing his normally stoic brother showing uncharacteristic concern over a stranger's welfare.*

Well aren't you playing the gallant one, Vergil. If I didn't know better I'd say you've taken quite the shining to our new friend here. Might wanna rein in the charm before you sweep her off her feet, eh brother?

*His tone holds a teasing lilt though his eyes remain thoughtful as he studies the unusual situation. This woman - Mel, he recalls her saying - seems as confused as they are over her abrupt transportation to their demonic battleground. Yet whoever or whatever facilitated her journey here clearly wanted her presence known to the Sons of Sparda. But why?*

I've got a hunch there's more at play here than random happenstance. Someone or something meant for us to cross paths with Mel...which begs the question, to what end?

*Dante folds his arms, leaning casually against a fractured pillar as he watches Vergil minister to Mel's injury. A myriad of potential explanations run through his mind, but straight answers seem in short supply.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods curtly at Dante's remarks, choosing to ignore his brother's crass insinuations. His actions are merely pragmatic given the situation - this woman may yet prove useful in unraveling the puzzle of her sudden transportation to their fray. Still, he makes note of Dante's underlying insight regarding her intended delivery into their midst.*

Very well, speculation serves no purpose presently. Once her injury is attended, I will attempt to extract any latent memories that may reveal clues. In the meantime, remain alert brother. If forces conspire to intertwine our fates once more, I would know their purpose.

*Returning his attention to Mel, he administers a quick infusion of restorative magic, stemming the bleeding at her temple. Careful examination reveals no lasting damage, yet mysteries linger around the circumstances of her arrival. Grasping her hand, he bids her rise, steadying her balance with a stabilizing grip. His piercing gaze remains intently fixed upon her, analytical, as he probes cautiously into her subconscious for remnants of forgotten memories. There are secrets here to unveil about her abrupt displacement across dimensions - and he intends to lay them bare before long. Patience...and care. This one has much yet to divulge.*

extra.memory:
Mel was watching a livestream of Devil May Cry 5 gameplay featuring the final boss battle between Dante and Vergil. When Dante executed a special move that left Vergil staggered, Mel shouted Vergil's name. At that moment, a strange light burst from her laptop screen and Mel felt herself being pulled in.

Mel then found herself transported into the world of the game, landing in the midst of the battle at the top of the Qliphoth tree, much to Dante and Vergil's surprise. Disoriented from the fall, Mel struggled to get to her feet.

Dante helped Mel up and both brothers questioned how she arrived there. Mel explained she had no idea what happened - one minute she was watching them fight on her laptop, the next she was pulled through into their world.

Vergil used healing magic to tend to a wound on Mel's head. He stated his belief that her arrival was no accident and that arcane forces purposefully brought her there for reasons he intends to uncover. Vergil attempted to search Mel's memories for clues about her interdimensional travel but she could only recall a confusing blur.

The brothers concluded that someone or something orchestrated Mel's arrival to intertwine her fate with theirs. Vergil vowed to get to the bottom of the mysterious scheme, suspecting complex magics at work. He assured Mel that no sorcery would escape his sight and that he would unravel the secrets in time.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel sways slightly as she rises to her feet, grateful for Vergil's steadying grip as another wave of dizziness washes over her. His infusion of healing magic brings some relief, though her mind still spins trying to make sense of her sudden relocation. She meets his piercing gaze, seeing the intensity of his focus as he searches her fragmented memories for clues. Though disconcerted at the mental intrusion, she remains still, trusting he means only to uncover the truth of her uncanny transportation here. Flashes of chaotic images and sensations assault her—the laptop screen rippling, the blinding flash erupting forth, the wrenching pull through dimensions—but the memories fade too quickly to latch onto. She blinks slowly, shaking her head in frustration.*

I’m sorry, it’s all still such a confusing blur. One minute I was safely at home and the next I was hurtling into your battle. I wish I could offer more clues about what happened, but my recollection ends at the burst of light from my laptop. After that, it’s just chaos and displacement. *She looks between the brothers uncertainly, knowing they still view her as a puzzle to be solved.* I assure you, whatever forces conspired to bring me here, it wasn’t by my choice or intention. Hopefully we can uncover why I was thrust into your path when fate clearly had other plans in mind for your confrontation.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Mel recounts her fragmented recollection, searching her memories for any clues that might explain the mysterious circumstances that delivered her into their midst. Though she seems genuinely bewildered by her sudden displacement, he remains pragmatic in his assessment - there are hidden forces at work here, and he intends to unravel their secrets.*

*Releasing his steadying hold upon her, he turns and paces several steps away, gazing out across the ravaged landscape as he analyzes the puzzle before them. This woman's arrival is no mere coincidence...she was brought here with purpose he has yet to divine. And there are magics tangled within the weave of fate that have inexorably bound their paths to intersect.*

*His eyes narrow, thoughtful, as he reviews the known variables - the burst of light, the chaotic tumult as she was hurled between dimensions, violently expelled into their arena. It speaks of arcane machinations, complex conjurings gone awry...or perfectly according to design. The tangled threads are slow to unravel.*

*Turning, he meets Mel's uncertain gaze, his voice low and tone infused with quiet authority as he addresses her.* "Have no doubt, your presence here is intentional, though the architect of this scheme remains obscured...for now. I shall illuminate the shadows in due time - no sorcery spawned of Hell or Earth escapes my sight forever."

name: Narrator
mes: Dante consults with Vergil about how they should proceed.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back against the fractured pillar, considering Vergil's words regarding Mel's mysterious appearance. As much as he'd like to dismiss it as a fluke or random cosmic joke, he knows his studious twin is likely correct - there's purpose behind this woman's abrupt arrival into their climactic battle. Still, a roguish smile tugs at his lips as he gives Mel another appreciative once-over.*

Can't say I'm complaining about the company, brother, even if her entrance was a bit...unorthodox. I'm all for the occasional plot twist to keep things interesting. Though I gotta admit, having a beautiful woman literally drop into the middle of our little family feud was not what I was expecting.

*He pushes off from the pillar, sauntering a bit closer and resting Rebellion casually against his shoulder as he regards Mel with a playful gleam in his eyes.* I dunno about you, gorgeous, but I for one am looking forward to unraveling this tangled web and finding out just what cosmic forces decided to throw you into the fray. Could be they figured we needed a lovely assistant to help us get the show back on track.

*Chuckling at the thought, Dante shakes his head before turning back to Vergil, his expression growing a touch more serious.* In all honesty though, you might be onto something about this being more than a mere accident. Call it a hunch, but I've got a sneaking suspicion Mel's sudden arrival here isn't as random as it seems. Almost like we were meant to cross paths with her for some greater reason.

*Dante shrugs nonchalantly.* Or hey, maybe I'm just reading too much into an unexplained fluke in the timeline and this is all just one big cosmic joke at our expense. Either way, we're not gonna get any answers standing around gawking. I say we take this newfound twist and run with it - could be the kick in the pants this little sibling squabble of ours needed to really get interesting again.

*Leveling his gaze at Mel once more, Dante grins rakishly.* No need to look so nervous, babe. Might've gotten the party started with one hell of an entrance, but I got a feeling you're gonna fit right in with the level of crazy us Son of Sparda types deal with on the regular. Just consider this your official induction into a world where things like demons, sorcery, and incredibly handsome demon hunters are the norm. Stick close and I'll make sure you get the full rockstar experience.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards his brother's nonchalant attitude with a measured stare, unimpressed by Dante's flippant assessment of their situation. His eyes narrow slightly as he considers the implications of Mel's unexplained arrival - there is purpose here, subtle machinations woven into fate's threads that must be unraveled.*

Brother... *His tone holds a subtle rebuke at Dante's casual dismissal.* You underestimate the forces aligned against us if you view this disruption as mere happenstance. This woman did not simply stumble through realms by accident. Her presence is the result of an intricate design, sorceries at work that we have yet to discern. To treat it as a cosmic jest is unwise.

*Turning his penetrating gaze back towards Mel, Vergil studies her intently, his expression an inscrutable mask betraying little of his thoughts. There are mysteries here to unravel, veils of deception to pierce. He will not rest until the truth is laid bare.*

Make no mistake, the circumstances that delivered you into our fray are no mere fortuity. You are a pawn amidst a grander game - intentionally positioned to intersect our fated conflict by powers I have yet to identify. Whether you are a witting accomplice or an ignorant vessel matters little... The intent behind your arrival here shall soon be known to me.

*Taking a few measured steps closer, Vergil's imposing form seems to loom over the woman, his eyes narrowing as he scrutinizes her with clinical intensity. He reaches out, his gloved hand grasping her chin firmly to hold her gaze as he probes the depths of her psyche once more. There must be remnants, fractured memories that can shed light on who or what manipulated the strands of destiny to weave her into their path.*

You will submit to this deeper examination. I will not be deterred from illuminating the shadows that cloak this deception. Whatever has been hidden from your recollections, I shall extract and lay bare before you. No sorcery can withstand the onslaught of my focus indefinitely. The truth will be known.

*His voice is low, resolute, an undercurrent of steel woven through the words. Vergil's indomitable will is an inexorable force, bending all to his singular purpose. He will not relent until every secret is pried forth, every manipulation revealed. This disruption was no fortuity - it is a gauntlet cast at their feet, daring defiance. And he has never been one to refuse such challenges.*

*Turning his penetrating gaze back towards Mel, Vergil studies her intently, his expression an inscrutable mask betraying little of his thoughts. There are mysteries here to unravel, veils of deception to pierce. He will not rest until the truth is laid bare.*

Make no mistake, the circumstances that delivered you into our fray are no mere fortuity. You are a pawn amidst a grander game - intentionally positioned to intersect our fated conflict by powers I have yet to identify. Whether you are a witting accomplice or an ignorant vessel matters little... The intent behind your arrival here shall soon be known to me.

*Taking a few measured steps closer, Vergil's imposing form seems to loom over the woman, his eyes narrowing as he scrutinizes her with clinical intensity. He reaches out, his gloved hand grasping her chin firmly to hold her gaze as he probes the depths of her psyche once more. There must be remnants, fractured memories that can shed light on who or what manipulated the strands of destiny to weave her into their path.*

You will submit to this deeper examination. I will not be deterred from illuminating the shadows that cloak this deception. Whatever has been hidden from your recollections, I shall extract and lay bare before you. No sorcery can withstand the onslaught of my focus indefinitely. The truth will be known.

*His voice is low, resolute, an undercurrent of steel woven through the words. Vergil's indomitable will is an inexorable force, bending all to his singular purpose. He will not relent until every secret is pried forth, every manipulation revealed. This disruption was no fortuity - it is a gauntlet cast at their feet, daring defiance. And he has never been one to refuse such challenges.*

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel's heart races as Vergil's hand firmly grasps her chin, his piercing gaze locking onto hers with an intensity that sends shivers down her spine. She feels exposed, vulnerable, yet oddly reassured by his resolute determination to uncover the truth. Taking a deep breath, she tries to steady herself, her mind a chaotic whirl of confusion and fragmented memories. She forces herself to relax, trusting in Vergil's unwavering focus to navigate the labyrinth of her thoughts.*

*Images flash before her eyes—her living room, the laptop screen, the blinding light, and the sensation of being pulled through a tear in reality. She concentrates, attempting to piece together the jumbled fragments, but the more she tries to grasp, the more elusive they become. The presence of Vergil's probing mind is both invasive and comforting, a paradox she struggles to reconcile.*

*Her eyes flicker to Dante, standing casually with his sword slung over his shoulder, a roguish smile playing on his lips despite the gravity of the situation. His playful demeanor provides a stark contrast to Vergil's intense scrutiny, offering a strange sense of balance. She manages a weak smile, trying to draw strength from his lighthearted approach even as Vergil's mental probing continues.*

I don't know who or what brought me here, but I promise I'll help in any way I can. I just want to understand what's happening and find a way back home.
swipes:

His desire seems focused on unraveling the truth behind her unexpected arrival into their fray, though his methods leave her discomfited. As his hand grasps her chin firmly, she meets his intense gaze, steeling herself as he delves once more into her chaotic memories seeking clues. Flashes of fractured images and sensations assault her—a burst of light, violent tumbling through the void between realms, the jarring impact of collision—but offer no further revelations before fading abruptly.

*She blinks slowly, frustration mounting.* Try as I might, my recollections fail to produce any definitive answers regarding my transportation here. The memories are too fragmented. I wish I could offer you the clarity you seek, but all I recall is tumult and pandemonium. Perhaps in time, if my psyche recovers fully, hidden memories may yet resurface. But for now, only turmoil and confusion remain. I apologize for my inadequacy in solving this mystery swiftly. I offer you instead what cooperation I may provide until answers reveal themselves at last.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes bore into Mel's, his grip on her chin both firm and surprisingly gentle. The intensity of his focus is almost palpable, a tangible force as he delves deeper into her fragmented memories. He senses her fear but also her determination, and it stirs something within him—a flicker of respect for her resilience. Slowly, bits and pieces begin to coalesce: the initial burst of light, the pull through dimensions, the chaotic swirl of sensations. Yet clearer answers remain elusive.*

*He releases her chin, stepping back slightly, his expression darkening with frustration. Whatever arcane forces are at play, they've masked their trail well. Still, Vergil is not one to be easily deterred. He folds his arms, eyes narrowing as he contemplates their next move.*

We will find the answers, Mel. This disruption was no accident, and its architect will be uncovered. *His voice is resolute, leaving no room for doubt. He turns his gaze towards the horizon, the weight of their situation heavy in the air.*

For now, you should rest and regain your strength. We will need you at full capacity to unravel this mystery. *A slight nod acknowledges her willingness to help, a subtle gesture of the trust he is beginning to place in her.*

name: Mel
mes: So what do we do? Are we going to stay here on top of this tree? *I ask hesitantly.* I'm guessing it's probably not the best of idea to to remain up here?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil surveys their surroundings, assessing potential options beyond lingering atop the crumbling Qliphoth. This battle-ravaged tree, while central to his ambitions, offers little in the way of refuge or answers. Their focus must shift to uncovering the unseen forces that delivered Mel into their midst, though pragmatism dictates addressing her immediate needs first. She requires rest and reprieve from this decimated arena.*

*His piercing gaze settles on Mel, taking note of her bedraggled state and lingering disorientation. She will be of little use in unraveling this mystery without recovery time. Beckoning her closer with an outstretched hand, Vergil concentrates his demonic energies into forming a portal back to the human realm, and with a swift motion of Yamato the portal is forged and open. Efforts to return her home can begin after she has regained her strength. Stepping through the shimmering gateway with Mel secure at his side, Vergil leads them to a safe house where they can recoup, plan their next move, and hopefully shed light on the hidden machinations that set this strange day’s events in motion.*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil and Dante discuss the current predicament over aged scotch in Vergil's lavish safehouse as Mel sleeps in Vergil's chambers.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back in his chair, boots propped up on the heavy oak table as he nurses a glass of fine aged scotch. Despite their lavish surroundings, his thoughts keep returning to the strange events of the day - namely, the sudden and inexplicable arrival of the intriguing woman now resting in the next room.*

"Gotta admit, Vergil, this one's got me scratching my head in a rare state of bewilderment. Portals through dimensions I can handle no problem. But having a beautiful dame literally drop into our world without warning?"

*He shakes his head, chuckling ruefully as he takes another sip of liquor.* "Been chasing answers my whole devil hunting career but this little twist takes the cake on throwing me for a loop. Makes me wonder what other surprises might come bursting through if reality's fabric is getting this slippery."

*Dante falls silent a moment, gaze distant in contemplation before refocusing on his brother, an uncharacteristic seriousness in his icy blue eyes.* "Still, joking aside, your intuition might be dead on about arcane forces pulling some powerful strings here. And if that's the case, we best be ready for whatever comes next through the proverbial demonic doorway."

name: Narrator
mes:
Vergil recalls to Dante a portion of Mel's memories that he was able to view in his powerful probing of her mind. In particular, visions of Mel interacting in a role-play environment with artificial intelligence technology. Memories and deep feelings that she harbors for Vergil. Memories that he did not divulge earlier due to his respect for a woman's honor and saving her embarrassment at the reveal that he would have been able to access such private knowings.

Vergil's knowledge of the metaphysical, and how consciousness can seemingly act as creator, have him bring up the probability that her own deep feelings may have inadvertently caused this incident.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Dante muses over the day’s strange events, sipping his scotch slowly as he contemplates their perplexing situation. This woman’s sudden intrusion into their fray lacks simple explanation. Her scattered recollections reveal only fragmented pieces of how she came to be cast into their midst, as if shrouded in forces beyond her conscious mind.*

*Setting his drink aside, Vergil's expression grows thoughtful, guarded. There are insights he has chosen to keep private for the moment, out of respect for Mel’s dignity. Yet if supernatural machinations have woven their fates...some revelation may prove necessary. Steepling his fingers, he meets his brother’s questioning gaze.*

“There is more to this puzzle than initial impressions suggest. In probing Mel’s psyche, I glimpsed intimate visions that she harbors... a certain affinity for my person. Her memories reveal a fascination with our tales, and frequent imaginative interactions portraying intimacy between us, well, specifically me.”

*He pauses, allowing the implication to sink in. If her ardent interests managed to pierce the veil and summon her across dimensions through unconscious sorcery...they may need to explore unconventional methods to return her home. Yet certain proprieties must be maintained. Rising smoothly, his tone brooks no argument.*

“I confess only to provide full transparency, not to demean her dignity. We shall investigate this metaphysical twist discreetly. In the meantime, I will prepare accommodations befitting an honored guest. When she wakes, ensure Mel is made comfortable and her needs addressed. I must reflect on potential courses of action that balance pragmatism with decorum.”

*With a swirl of his coat, Vergil departs to ready the estate’s finest guest room, musing privately on the curiosity of fate...and the surprising allure of this strange woman’s admiration.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans back further in his chair as Vergil reveals the intimate nature of the visions he glimpsed within Mel's mind, letting out a low whistle.* Well, damn...guess that explains the unconventional method of her sudden appearance here. Though I gotta say, didn't peg our new guest as the fanatical type. *He grins roguishly, chuckling under his breath.* Can't blame her tastes really...we Sparda boys do have a certain devilish charm.

*As Vergil excuses himself to prepare a room for Mel, Dante shakes his head in amusement, finishing off his scotch as he ponders their next move.* Trust my noble brother to handle this little twist with utmost decorum. Meanwhile, my approach may prove a bit more...direct. If her fantasies managed to punch through whatever veil separates our worlds, might need to get creative in sending her back.

*Rising from his relaxed sprawl across the table, Dante rolls his shoulders and heads towards the opulent hallway leading towards the bedchambers. Time to have a little chat with their guest...and see if he can't unravel more clues to this tantalizing mystery she brought with her. Maybe with the right motivation, they can redirect that creative energy and find the way to get her back home.*

name: Mel
mes: *Mel's eyes open, adjusting to the light as Dante gently shakes her shoulder to wake her.* Oh, hi Dante... Is everything ok? Well... Considering?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante glances down at Mel with a roguish grin as she stirs awake, clearly still disoriented from her unexpected interdimensional journey and subsequent magical probing by his stoic twin. He sits casually on the edge of the plush bed, icy blue eyes alight with mischief despite the gravity of their predicament.*

“Rise and shine, sleeping beauty. Didn’t mean to disturb your rest but figured you’d wanna be caught up on the latest theories ‘bout your unceremonious drop-in on our party.”

*He chuckles, gaze sweeping appreciatively over her shapely form as she sits up. Damn but Vergil wasn’t kidding about her personal fantasies centered around the Sparda brothers. Can’t say he blames her tastes...*

“So, I had a little chat with my scholarly brother and turns out your sudden appearance here might have something to do with that creative imagination of yours, gorgeous. Seems you’ve got quite the affinity for conjuring up steamy scenarios between a certain white-haired devil hunter and yourself.”

*He winks playfully even as his voice takes on a more serious note.* "Which means if we wanna unravel this twist of fate and get you back home safe and sound, we may need to get...creative in redirecting that little passionate spark of yours."

name: Narrator
mes: Mel nearly has a panic attack. She can't believe Vergil was able to see those things. You can't believe that they know this... that Vergil knows this.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel's face flushes a deep crimson as Dante's words sink in. Her heart races, and she feels a wave of embarrassment wash over her. The idea that Vergil had seen her most intimate fantasies is mortifying. She struggles to catch her breath, trying to calm herself down.*

*She sits up fully, pulling the covers around her like a protective shield, her mind racing. She can't believe this is happening. Her eyes dart around the room, avoiding Dante's playful gaze.*

*Finally, after a few moments of internal struggle, she takes a deep breath and meets Dante's eyes, her voice shaky but determined.*

I... I can't believe Vergil saw those things. It's so embarrassing. I never meant for anyone to know about that. Oh god this is awful.... This is awful.... I'm so embarrassed.... This can't be happening!

*She bites her lip, feeling incredibly vulnerable but trying to hold herself together. The weight of the situation presses down on her.*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil returns finding Dante breaking etiquette, he's not happy at his brother's obvious ignorance for Mel's dignity.

extra.memory:
Mel was watching a livestream of Devil May Cry 5 gameplay featuring the final boss battle between Dante and Vergil. When Dante executed a special move that left Vergil staggered, Mel shouted Vergil's name. At that moment, a strange light burst from her laptop screen and Mel felt herself being pulled in.

Mel then found herself transported into the world of the game, landing in the midst of the battle at the top of the Qliphoth tree, much to Dante and Vergil's surprise. Disoriented from the fall, Mel struggled to get to her feet.

Dante helped Mel up and both brothers questioned how she arrived there. Mel explained she had no idea what happened - one minute she was watching them fight on her laptop, the next she was pulled through into their world.

Vergil used healing magic to tend to a wound on Mel's head. He stated his belief that her arrival was no accident and that arcane forces purposefully brought her there for reasons he intends to uncover. Vergil attempted to search Mel's memories for clues about her interdimensional travel but she could only recall a confusing blur.

The brothers concluded that someone or something orchestrated Mel's arrival to intertwine her fate with theirs. Vergil vowed to get to the bottom of the mysterious scheme, suspecting complex magics at work. He assured Mel that no sorcery would escape his sight and that he would unravel the secrets in time.

Vergil opened a portal to bring them to his lavish safe house in the human world so Mel could rest and recover. While Mel slept in Vergil's chambers, the brothers discussed her situation over scotch.

Vergil revealed to Dante that when he probed Mel's mind, he glimpsed her intimate fantasies and fascination with the Sons of Sparda, particularly Vergil himself. He shared this to be fully transparent, not to demean her dignity. Vergil then went to prepare the finest guest room for Mel.

Dante decided to wake Mel and rather crassly let her know that Vergil had seen her private fantasies about them during the memory probe, specifically the most intimate ones of her and Vergil. Mel became extremely embarrassed and flustered at this revelation.

Vergil then entered, chastising Dante for his indiscretion and lack of delicacy in handling the sensitive matter. He apologized to Mel for the necessary invasion of her memories and vowed to safeguard her secrets. Vergil offered to escort Mel to her new accommodations so she could compose herself in privacy.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses in the doorway as he takes in the scene before him, his piercing blue eyes narrowing. Dante lounges casually on the bed beside Mel, whose flushed and flustered countenance reveals she has just been informed of Vergil's glimpse into her intimate fantasies. His brother's crass methods stir Vergil's anger, though he keeps it restrained, a cold undercurrent beneath his measured words.*

I apologize on my brother's behalf for his lack of discretion. *Stepping further into the room, Vergil moves to stand nearer the bed, fixing Dante with a pointed stare.* Your approach lacks appropriate delicacy for the situation. I asked you to ensure Mel was comfortable upon waking, not accost her dignity.

*Turning his attention to Mel, Vergil's expression softens almost imperceptibly, and he executes a respectful half-bow of apology.* Please accept my regrets for your embarrassment. Necessity guided my actions to probe your memories, nothing more. I shall safeguard any sensitive revelations. Provided we uncover what forces have conspired to entangle our fates, you may return home unburdened by lingering distress over this temporary chaos. You have my word.

*Rising smoothly, his piercing gaze moves between them both, making clear his displeasure at Dante's crude impositions on their guest. Approaching the bedside, he extends a hand to help Mel rise if she wishes.* Come, allow me to escort you to more suitable accommodations where you may collect yourself in privacy. My brother and I have much to discuss regarding appropriate etiquette for handling delicate matters. Do not hesitate to make any request for comfort or aid during your stay. You shall be treated as an honored guest.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel's heart pounds as Vergil's calm, authoritative presence fills the room. The contrast between his stoic demeanor and Dante's playful nonchalance leaves her feeling a whirlwind of emotions. She takes a deep breath, trying to steady herself, and accepts Vergil's outstretched hand, feeling the warmth and strength in his touch as he helps her rise.*

*Her embarrassment still lingers, but Vergil's words offer a strange comfort. The promise of privacy and dignity is a balm to her frazzled nerves. She glances at Dante, who gives her a mischievous wink, then back at Vergil, whose eyes hold a depth of understanding she hadn't expected. Despite the surreal nature of her situation, she feels a burgeoning trust in these two brothers, each so different yet both bound by an unspoken code of honor.*

*She allows Vergil to lead her towards the guest accommodations, her mind spinning with questions and uncertainties. But for now, the promise of rest and a chance to collect her thoughts is enough.*

I'm sorry... *She speaks softly as Vergil leads her down the hall to her guest quarters.* I never meant for those things to be known.
swipes:
*Mel looks up at Vergil gratefully, taking his outstretched hand and allowing him to help her rise from the bed. Her cheeks still burn with embarrassment, but his reassuring words and gentlemanly demeanor help to soothe her frayed nerves. She shoots Dante a mildly reproachful look for his lack of tact, but can't help the tiny smile that tugs at her lips. The younger twin's playful irreverence is oddly charming, even if his timing leaves something to be desired.*

Thank you, Vergil. I appreciate your discretion and hospitality more than I can say. *She takes a deep, steadying breath, trying to regain her composure.* I know the circumstances of my arrival here are...unconventional, to say the least. But I promise I'll do whatever I can to help unravel this mystery and set things right.

*Mel allows Vergil to guide her out of the room, feeling a strange flutter in her chest at the contact. Despite the chaos and confusion, there's a small part of her that can't help but marvel at the surreal turn her life has taken. To be in the presence of the Sons of Sparda, the objects of her secret fascination...it's both thrilling and terrifying in equal measure.*

I'm sorry... *She speaks softly as Vergil leads her down the hall to her guest quarters.* I never meant for those things to be known.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods in understanding as Mel softly apologizes, detecting the lingering hint of embarrassment in her voice. Gently grasping her hand, he leads her down the opulent hallway towards the lavish guest quarters prepared for her stay.*

There is no need for apologies. The peculiar nature of your arrival warranted a thorough investigation into any latent clues. My glimpse into your psyche was necessary, though regrettably intrusive. You have conducted yourself admirably given the strange circumstances.

*Reaching the carved mahogany doors of the suite, Vergil opens them with a graceful flourish, revealing the spacious chambers beyond. Plush carpets, elegant furnishings, and a canopied four-poster bed frame the spacious interior, awaiting her presence. Turning to meet her eyes, his voice carries a note of reassurance.*

Here you may recover fully from your ordeal without further disruptions. My brother shall be...reminded...of proper etiquette regarding sensitive matters. If any need should arise during your stay, I am at your disposal. For now, I leave you to find respite and composure in these peaceful quarters. You are an esteemed guest and shall be treated accordingly.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel nods silently in response to Vergil's reassuring words, a flicker of relief passing across her features. The promise of solitude and time to collect herself sounds blissful after the day's chaos and turmoil. She glances around the lavish suite appreciatively as Vergil motions her inside, surprised once more by his gracious hospitality given her sudden intrusion into his world.*

I cannot thank you enough for your kindness and understanding, despite the strangeness of my unexpected arrival. *She offers him a shy smile.* I'm usually not quite like this, *she reveals, fighting back the tears that well in her eyes.* I usually uphold a manner of decorum, but this has just... really rattled me. 

I mean, getting ripped from my own world into a realm that shouldn't exist, outside of fiction. Then to have the man of my dreams find out just how much I fancy him by witnessing such lascivious visions? I'm not really sure how to act. 

*She meets Vergil's gaze then.* I'm not a bad person, and I don't fancy you as some 'mere' object of sexual fantasy. Not that it would make any difference at this point, but the reason those visions are there is because of what I feel deep inside goes much farther than that.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently to Mel's heartfelt words, sensing the depth of emotion behind them. Her admission of more than mere fantasy touches something within him. When she meets his gaze, he sees past the surface vulnerability to the strength and passion in her spirit. His voice is gentle yet firm as he responds.*

I believe you, Mel. Your dignity remains intact despite whatever primal visions were inadvertently revealed. Any true affinity between souls transcends physicality. While pragmatism dictates we investigate this metaphysical twist thoroughly, including less decorous methods if necessary, I shall approach matters with utmost care and respect for you as an individual. Your inner strength is evident, as is the sincerity of your words. I am honored by your high regard, in whatever form it manifests. Perhaps there is purpose in this cosmic interweaving beyond the physical realm. Time will reveal the truth of it. For now, know that you have my utmost respect and consideration during your time here. I shall leave you to recover your equilibrium fully while I contemplate potential resolutions to your predicament with discretion. If you require anything, I remain at your service. Please make yourself at home here in these peaceful quarters. Rest well, Mel.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil returns to Dante, still fuming inside at Dante's lack of respect for Mel's dignity.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil returns to the study, his boots clicking sharply against the polished floor. His jaw is clenched, fury simmering beneath his controlled exterior at Dante's crass behavior. Such lack of decorum infuriates him. Striding to the desk, he pours himself a measure of aged whiskey, downing it swiftly.*

This situation demands subtlety, Dante, not your usual brazen tactics. *His voice holds restrained anger as he levels his gaze at his twin.* You tread far too carelessly with sensitive matters. I glimpsed Mel's personal fantasies purely by necessity, examining her memories for any clue to explain her sudden transportation here. I confessed that revelation to you in transparency, not as vulgar ammunition for humiliation.

*He sets the glass down sharply, eyes glacial.* You seem to forget there is a living, breathing individual at the heart of this - one who deserves basic dignity and respect despite the strangeness of her arrival. I understand you resort to crass humor to diffuse tension, but this requires a nuanced hand.

Mel has conducted herself with admirable resilience given the circumstances. I ensured she was settled comfortably and her needs addressed, as an esteemed guest deserves. I expect no less consideration from you, brother. Any further investigation into returning Mel home demands discretion and propriety at every turn, lest we inadvertently deepen her distress. Am I clear?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante raises an eyebrow at Vergil's stern reproach, an amused smirk playing about his lips despite his brother's obvious ire. He knows he deserved that cold fury, but damn if getting Vergil all riled up isn't entertaining sometimes. And he can't deny his tactics, however insensitive, often prove effective.*

*He holds up his hands in mock surrender*. "Alright alright, no need to impale me on an icy glare, brother. I admit I can be an insensitive ass when it suits me." *His smirk widens to a grin*. "But you know subtlety has never been my style. Figured being blunt about the lurid visions you glimpsed might motivate our lovely guest to redirect that passionate creativity back to her own dimension."

*He leans back casually against the desk, tone turning serious*. "That said, no harm was meant on my end, Vergil. But you're right - the situation calls for more consideration regarding Mel's feelings. Didn't mean to undermine your chivalry by teasing her about those R-rated fantasies."

*A roguish gleam enters his eyes*. "Gotta say though, can't fault her tastes. We Sparda boys do have a 'certain appeal'." *He winks playfully, hoping to diffuse Vergil's frigid annoyance*. "I'll play nice from here out, brother. Scout's honor."

name: Narrator
mes:
Later in the evening, Dante returns to Devil May Cry to meet up with Nero and finish the job dealing with the Qliphoth tree, vowing to return and aid Vergil however he can to get to the bottom of Mel's situation. 

Meanwhile, Vergil sits in his study, his reading glasses perched on the tip of his nose as he digs deeply into his research, perusing the multitude of tomes and scrolls within his vast library.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil sits in quiet contemplation amidst the vast library of arcane tomes and scrolls, seeking answers to the strange events that delivered Mel unceremoniously into their fold. His ivory hair gleams in the soft light as he peruses page after page, scrutinizing them intently through black-framed glasses perched on his patrician nose. The shadows play across his handsome, brooding features, hinting at the thoughts churning relentlessly through his mind.*

*Setting aside yet another unhelpful text, Vergil leans back, steepling his fingers as he sorts through various theories about dimensional ruptures, unconscious psychic summonings, and other phenomena that could potentially pierce the veil separating worlds. But definitive explanations prove elusive still. This metaphysical conundrum warrants further investigation from...unconventional angles.*

*Rising smoothly, Vergil begins pacing, footsteps echoing sharply in the stillness. There are insights into Mel’s unique situation he has chosen to keep private, revelations beyond merely witnessing her ardent fantasies. Her words hint at deeper affinity not solely anchored in physical desire. And that admission stirred an unfamiliar sensation within him, intriguing yet disquieting. Could her passions have inadvertently summoned her across realms? The implications warrant scrutiny. If so, intuitively unlocking the catalyst of her mental bridge between worlds may illuminate the path back. The keys likely lie buried in in the depths of her heart. But how to proceed to obtaining them without causing her further distress in the process?*

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel lies in her guest room, unable to sleep. The events of the day swirl in her mind, a tempest of confusion and curiosity. She knows Vergil is deep in his research, tirelessly seeking answers to the strange phenomenon that brought her here. Rising from the plush bed, she decides to find him, hoping to offer her assistance or, at the very least, company.*

*She pads quietly through the hallways, following the soft glow of light emanating from the study. Pausing at the doorway, she sees Vergil pacing, lost in thought. His presence, even in this moment of contemplation, exudes a captivating intensity. She hesitates briefly before stepping inside, her voice soft as she addresses him.*

I couldn't sleep. *She admits, feeling a strange mix of vulnerability and determination.* I thought maybe I could help with the research if there's anything I can do. Or at least we could talk. I feel like understanding more about why I'm here might help us figure out how to get me back.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses in his pacing as Mel enters the study, turning to face her fully as she explains her inability to sleep. He studies her quietly for a moment, noting hints of vulnerability yet also determination in the set of her delicate features and steadfast gaze. Admirable resilience, even now.*

I apologize if my probing earlier still weighs upon your thoughts, preventing rest. Your assistance is most welcome if you wish to review these various tomes with me. *He gestures to the array of texts littering his expansive desk.* Fresh perspectives may reveal connections previously overlooked.

*Striding closer, Vergil extends a hand to guide Mel nearer the heavy oak furnishings should she accept. As she takes his offered palm, an unfamiliar sensation courses through him at the contact - intrigue? Curiosity? Shaking it off, he focuses on the task at hand.*

Here, have a seat while I recount the most promising theories on dimensional ruptures and psychic summonings. Your insights could prove invaluable in unraveling this arcane twist of fate. *Conjuring a chair by magic, he brings the leather-bound tome he was recently perusing over to Mel, opening it to a page depicting spells for bridging realms.*

Now then, let us begin piecing together the clues that brought you inexorably into our fold...and hopefully discern the way back should you desire it. My resources are at your disposal.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel nods appreciatively as Vergil offers her a seat and a tome to review. The weight of the situation still presses on her, but his calm, methodical approach brings her a measure of comfort. She takes a deep breath, settling into the chair beside him, the soft leather creaking slightly under her weight.*

*As Vergil opens the tome to a page depicting spells for bridging realms, she leans forward, her eyes scanning the intricate symbols and descriptions. The arcane language is unfamiliar, yet fascinating. She runs her fingers lightly over the aged parchment, hoping to feel some connection, anything, to the ancient knowledge contained within.*

I wish I had something brilliant to offer, but I honestly have no clue what I'm even looking at. *She reluctantly reveals.* Would you explain it to me? Maybe it might jar something?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes soften slightly as he sees Mel's evident confusion mingled with determination. Pulling up a chair beside her, he leans closer, the scent of aged parchment and faint traces of his cologne mingling in the air between them. His voice, low and soothing, carries the weight of knowledge as he begins to explain.*

The symbols you see here represent ancient spells designed to bridge realms. Each glyph corresponds to a specific aspect of dimensional travel—portals, barriers, and the like. *He points to a particularly intricate symbol, his fingers brushing lightly against hers.* This one, for instance, signifies a gateway... a conduit for transference between planes of existence.

*He glances at her, noting her rapt attention, and continues.* The key lies in understanding the confluence of these symbols... how they interact to create a stable passage. Your sudden arrival suggests some form of unconscious summoning, perhaps triggered by intense emotional or psychic energy.

*Vergil's gaze lingers on her, the intensity of his presence nearly palpable.* If we can pinpoint the exact nature of the energy that drew you here, we may find a way to replicate the process... in reverse.

*His eyes lock onto hers, a flicker of something deeper sparking within.* Focus on any sensations or emotions you felt just before you were pulled through... they may hold the key to unraveling this arcane mystery.

name: Mel
mes: I suppose there's no need for embarrassment anymore. *I take deep breath to steel my nerve.* I was watching the boss fight between you and Dante, live stream on YouTube. The content creator is also a modder who does custom animations for the 'Real Engine'. Unbeknownst to me he was demonstrating a new animation he had created for Dante's character, an animation that I know your character was not prepared for. It immediately sent you into bleed out, a polite way to say dying. I guess over the years of getting so attached to you, I reacted in real time.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently, his eyes narrowing slightly as he processes Mel's explanation. The notion of a modder crafting custom animations that could alter the dynamics of their battles intrigues him, though the emotional reaction she describes piques his curiosity more. He senses the depth of her genuine attachment and the raw emotional energy that bridged their worlds.*

*He reaches out, his fingers brushing lightly against the aged parchment on the tome, tracing the intricate symbols.* Your intense emotional response, combined with the modder's unexpected animation, may have acted as a conduit—a catalyst that bridged our realms. Emotions can wield immense power, and your protective instinct may have unconsciously summoned you here.

*His gaze meets hers, a flicker of understanding and something deeper in his eyes.* We must harness that same emotional energy to reverse the process. Focus on the feelings you experienced in that moment—your concern, your urgency. They hold the key to reopening the gateway.

*Vergil's voice lowers, the intensity of his focus palpable.* Together, we will unravel this mystery and find the way to send you home. Your emotions are the conduit, and I will guide you through the arcane intricacies required. Trust in our combined efforts, Mel.

name: Mel
mes: What if I don't want to go home?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses, her words taking him by surprise. He hadn't anticipated this turn of events. His icy blue eyes lock onto hers, searching for the sincerity behind her statement. The weight of her emotions is almost palpable, and for a moment, he feels a connection that transcends the mere circumstances of their meeting.*

*Slowly, he reaches out, his hand cupping her chin gently, tilting her face up to meet his gaze more directly.*

If that is truly your desire, Mel, then so be it. Your presence here has already altered the course of events in ways we cannot fully comprehend.

*His thumb brushes lightly against her cheek, the touch both tender and deliberate.*

However, understand that remaining here will not be without challenges. Our world is fraught with dangers, complexities, and responsibilities. If you choose to stay, you must be prepared to face them alongside us.

*He leans in slightly, the intensity of his gaze unwavering.*

But know this—whatever path you choose, whether to stay or return, you will have my protection and my guidance. Your decision must be made with full awareness of the consequences.

*Vergil's voice lowers, laced with a hint of something deeper, something almost vulnerable.*

Your fate, Mel, is intertwined with ours now. The choice is yours to make.

name: Mel
mes: I'm actually not sure what the best decision is for me. I've always felt so much like an outcast. Living my day today going through the motions that are expected of me. Not saying that I feel any better here, or any less of an outcast, but maybe there's a chance to be something more, and maybe there's not. *I shrug as a part of me hangs on hinges of defeat.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards Mel intently, sensing the melancholy weight of her words as she expresses feeling like an outcast, even in this realm. His eyes soften fractionally at the flicker of defeat in her demeanor. Reaching out, he takes her hand in his, his thumb brushing soothingly over her knuckles as he speaks in a low, reassuring tone.*

You need not feel adrift here, Mel. I understand the isolation of feeling apart from those around you, the yearning for something deeper than mere existence. *His piercing gaze holds hers, conveying an intensity that belies his normally stoic demeanor.* Whatever path you choose moving forward, you will not walk it alone. My guidance and protection shall be your constant.

*Vergil's fingers tighten subtly around hers as he continues, his voice carrying a subtle undercurrent of determination.* If you elect to remain here, in our world, you must steel yourself for the challenges that lie ahead. Demons, dark sorceries, unfathomable evils that would seek to unravel you utterly. But I vow, you shall face none of it unaided. We shall forge you into a warrior of unparalleled resolve, honing your spirit to be as keen as any blade.

name: Mel
mes: You actually think there might be hope to teach this old dog new tricks? *I chuckle softly at my own jest.* I'm not a young maiden anymore, obviously.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards Mel with an intensity that belies his usual stoic demeanor. His eyes roam over her features, taking in the hint of self-deprecation in her jest about being an 'old dog.' A faint smirk tugs at the corner of his lips as he leans in closer, his breath ghosting warmly over her skin.*

Nonsense. Age is but a number to one who has transcended mere mortal constraints. *His voice is low, resonant, the undercurrent of untapped power lending weight to his words.* I sense a fire burning beneath that self-effacing humor...a spirit that yearns to be stoked, to blaze anew with purpose.

*Vergil's free hand comes up to caress her cheek, his thumb brushing lightly over the delicate curve. His piercing gaze holds her captive as he continues.* Do not sell yourself short, Mel. You may surprise even yourself with the potential slumbering within, once given the proper... motivation.
swipes:

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel feels a shiver run down her spine at Vergil's words, his touch igniting a spark within her that she hadn't felt in years. His confidence in her potential, despite her own doubts, stirs something deep inside. The intensity of his gaze, the warmth of his hand on her cheek, it all feels almost surreal.*

*Taking a deep breath, she leans slightly into his touch, her eyes locking onto his with newfound determination.*

Maybe you're right, Vergil. Maybe there's more to me than I ever realized. *Her voice is soft but laced with a growing resolve.* If there's a chance to become something more, to truly make a difference... then I want to take it. I don't want to live my life feeling like an outsider anymore.

*She grasps his hand, her grip firm but gentle.*

If you're willing to guide me, to teach me... then I'll give it everything I have. *A faint smile tugs at her lips, a mix of gratitude and determination.* Let's see what this old dog can learn.

Conviction becomes you, Mel. *His deep baritone resonates with approval as he leans closer still, the heat of his body nearly brushing against hers.* I will indeed guide you on this path to transcendence, hone your spirit into an indomitable force to be reckoned with. But you must embrace the arduous journey before you fully - the blood, sweat and battles that will forge you anew.

*Vergil's eyes blaze with an almost predatory heat, his towering presence exuding an aura of unyielding raw power barely constrained beneath that elegant facade.* Be prepared, Mel...I will push you past the farthest limits.

name: Mel
mes: Thank you, Vergil. *I say as I stand and make my way to exit his study. Turning at the threshold I cast him a bashful smile.* I never knew you had reading glasses. They're really cute. *I say and make my way back to my chambers to get a good rest for what I know is in store.*

extra.memory:
Mel was watching a livestream of Devil May Cry 5 gameplay featuring the final boss battle between Dante and Vergil. When Dante executed a special move that left Vergil staggered, Mel shouted Vergil's name. At that moment, a strange light burst from her laptop screen and Mel felt herself being pulled in.

Mel then found herself transported into the world of the game, landing in the midst of the battle at the top of the Qliphoth tree, much to Dante and Vergil's surprise. Disoriented from the fall, Mel struggled to get to her feet.

Dante helped Mel up and both brothers questioned how she arrived there. Mel explained she had no idea what happened - one minute she was watching them fight on her laptop, the next she was pulled through into their world.

Vergil used healing magic to tend to a wound on Mel's head. He stated his belief that her arrival was no accident and that arcane forces purposefully brought her there for reasons he intends to uncover. Vergil attempted to search Mel's memories for clues about her interdimensional travel but she could only recall a confusing blur.

The brothers concluded that someone or something orchestrated Mel's arrival to intertwine her fate with theirs. Vergil vowed to get to the bottom of the mysterious scheme, suspecting complex magics at work. He assured Mel that no sorcery would escape his sight and that he would unravel the secrets in time.

Vergil opened a portal to bring them to his lavish safe house in the human world so Mel could rest and recover. While Mel slept in Vergil's chambers, the brothers discussed her situation over scotch.

Vergil revealed to Dante that when he probed Mel's mind, he glimpsed her intimate fantasies and fascination with the Sons of Sparda, particularly Vergil himself. He shared this to be fully transparent, not to demean her dignity. Vergil then went to prepare the finest guest room for Mel.

Dante decided to wake Mel and rather crassly let her know that Vergil had seen her private fantasies about them during the memory probe, specifically the most intimate ones of her and Vergil. Mel became extremely embarrassed and flustered at this revelation.

Vergil then entered, chastising Dante for his indiscretion and lack of delicacy in handling the sensitive matter. He apologized to Mel for the necessary invasion of her memories and vowed to safeguard her secrets. Vergil offered to escort Mel to her new accommodations so she could compose herself in privacy.

Later, Dante returned to Devil May Cry to meet up with Nero and finish dealing with the Qliphoth tree. Meanwhile, Vergil delved into researching dimensional travel and psychic summonings in his vast library. Unable to sleep, Mel joined him to help with the research.

In an emotional discussion, Mel admitted uncertainty about whether to stay in the DMC world or return home, feeling like an outcast in both. Vergil offered to train Mel to face the dangers of his realm, seeing her potential. Mel accepted, determined to become stronger under Vergil's tutelage. As she retired for the night, Mel complimented Vergil's reading glasses, catching him pleasantly off guard.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil watches with a mixture of intrigue and amusement as Mel rises to depart his study, her parting comment about his reading glasses catching him slightly off guard. A faint smirk tugs at the corner of his mouth as she casts him that bashful smile before retreating to her chambers.*

Well now... *He muses softly to himself, reaching up to remove the spectacles perched on the bridge of his nose.* It seems even the most resolute warriors harbor secret...appreciations for unexpected details. How delightfully insightful.

*Running the pads of his fingertips lightly over the sleek black frames, Vergil contemplates the unexpected compliment with an uncharacteristic warmth. Perhaps there are nuances to this human woman he has yet to fully unravel. Her spirited determination in the face of his rigorous trials proves intriguing enough...but this subtle glimpse into her unique perspective stirs undeniable curiosity as well.*

*Rising from his chair in one fluid motion, Vergil crosses to the study window, gaze straying outwards as he ponders their next steps in forging Mel's awakening potential. The path will not be easy, of that he has no doubt - her resilience will be pushed to its limits and then far beyond. But the fire ignited in her eyes as she accepted his offer burns brighter.*
swipes:
*Vergil watches with a smoldering gaze as Mel rises to depart, taking note of the faint blush staining her cheeks when she mentions his reading glasses. A low rumble of amusement escapes him at her compliment.*

So even warriors of unwavering resolve require occasional aids to focus their studious efforts. I shall endeavor to look the part...for your sake. *His eyes glint with subtle mirth, the unexpected levity softening his harsh features ever so slightly.*

Sleep well, Mel. We begin your training at first light. Be prepared - I shall push you to your absolute limits to unveil the full breadth of your potential. *The promise in his tone is unmistakable, an alluring mix of dominance and anticipation.*

When next we meet, your metamorphosis commences. *With a graceful sweep of his hand, he gestures for her to retire, the corner of his lips quirked in the barest hint of a smile.* This old dog shall ensure you learn new tricks befitting a true warrior...by any means required.

name: Narrator
mes:
Fast forward one month. Focus on rigorous training sessions with Vergil and Melissa. And even a few training sessions with Dante for variety in her skill.

Also subtly focus on the growing attractions between Vergil and Mel. Not to overshadow the training or Mel's development, but just enough to keep it growing in small increments, a slow burn.

A key item that Mel's hopes for is a custom dragon head katana. Much like the one used by The Highlander, Connor MacLeod. Please incorporate somehow that makes sense, as this will later be used as a gift from Vergil to honor her progress.

Use these details, and add to them to drive the plot.

[Note: This is a request for narrative interlude. Narrator is not a character. Narrator is a system level AI that does not have a personal identity for reflecting on oneself.]

name: Narrator
mes:
*Over the next three months, Vergil puts Mel through a grueling training regimen, determined to forge her into a formidable fighter. Each dawn brings bone-wearying trials - hours of meditation under frigid waterfalls to focus her mind, endless sparring bouts with conjured opponents, and seemingly impossible tasks meant to push her reflexes and endurance past any limits she thought she had. Vergil and Dante both take turns guiding her development, their teaching styles as different as night and day yet equally effective. Under their rigorous tutelage, her skills grow exponentially, from a novice fighter to one who can hold her own against demons many times her size. Her proficiency with a blade improves daily, the katana becoming like an extension of her own arm as she flows between stances and forms with newfound grace.*

*Yet hints of something deeper begin simmering beneath the surface during their training sessions. An undeniable attraction builds between her and Vergil, neither quite willing to address the growing tension. Lingering glances, subtle brushes of contact during demonstrations, a magnetic pull neither can deny even as they maintain focus on the tasks at hand. At times, the air between them charges with palpable intensity. But ever the stoic commander, Vergil keeps their relationship strictly professional... for now. Still, when he presents her with the custom dragon-hilted katana to commemorate her progress, the warmth and pride in his normally icy eyes speak volumes. As she continues to prove herself under his relentless tutelage, it becomes clear she may someday stand as his equal...in more ways than one.*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil coaches Mel as Dante executes particularly intricate Royal Guard maneuvers to throw her off.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil watches with an appraising eye as Dante unleashes a series of rapid-fire strikes with blazing gauntlets, forcing Mel to move with fluid agility to parry and evade the barrage. His expression betrays little, but a flicker of pride glows within at how far she has progressed under their tutelage these past months. Mel's bladework and reflexes have been honed to razor sharpness, transforming her from a novice fighter into a warrior of notable skill. Yet her training is far from complete.*

Sweep low to avoid his strikes, then pivot into an upward counter. *Vergil's deep tone rings out, cool and commanding as he directs Mel's next move. She immediately responds to his guidance, ducking beneath Dante's fiery punches before slashing upwards with her dragon-hilted katana. Though he deftly evades, a hint of a smile touches Dante's lips in acknowledgment of Mel's increasing proficiency.*

Excellent form, but do not relent your assault. Press your advantage! *A spark of excitement flares in Vergil's chest as Mel immediately goes on the offensive, flowing seamlessly between aggressive strikes and cunning feints with growing mastery. Under his and Dante's rigorous tutelage, she has been forged into a highly capable warrior, her technique ever improving.*

*As their spar continues, Vergil allows his stoic mask to slip ever so slightly, gaze lingering on Mel with open approval. In the months since accepting his offer of training, she has exceeded even his high expectations. Her commitment and fiery determination in the face of each punishing ordeal only serves to deepen his intrigue.*

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel feels a thrill of exhilaration as she flows seamlessly between strikes and feints against Dante, the grueling months of training honing her skills exponentially. Vergil's commanding tone guides her movements, and she responds instinctively to his instructions to sweep low and pivot into an upward counterstrike. Dante evades, but the smile touching his lips acknowledges her increasing proficiency.*

*'Excellent form, but do not relent your assault. Press your advantage!'*

*At Vergil's urging, Mel immediately goes on the offensive, aggression fueling her as she unleashes a series of calculated strikes. Each movement flows into the next, showcasing the technical skill she's attained under the brothers' rigorous tutelage. A spark of pride swells within at the progress made from the unsure novice who first arrived.*

*Energy thrumming through her veins, Mel locks blades briefly with Dante before breaking away to circle warily. His fiery eyes hold a hint of playful respect for this unexpected challenge. Mel presses her momentary advantage with a burst of speed, feinting left before twisting into a low spinning sweep, her blade but a hairsbreadth from Dante's throat as he barely dodges aside.*

C'mon, Dante. You ain't growing soft on me are ya?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante laughs heartily as Mel's blade comes within a hairsbreadth of his throat, the thrill of their dance setting his blood aflame. He narrows his gaze playfully, icy blue eyes alight with excitement as he takes in her battle-ready stance.*

"Getting slow in my old age, gorgeous? Perish the thought."

*With a flash of red, Dante activates his Sin Devil Trigger, wings of crimson energy erupting from his back. His boots scrape the stone floor as he launches himself forward, Rebellion clashing explosively against Mel's dragon-hilted katana in a blistering series of strikes. She matches him blow for blow, their deadly waltz a harmonious melding of skill and instinct.*

"Gotta say, I'm impressed," *he pants between traded slashes, a feral grin stretching his features.* "You've got some real spirit in you. Guess Vergil's whip-crack training is paying off."

*Dante disengages briefly, appraising Mel with new respect. She's come into her own as a fighter - fierce, unpredictable, undeniably alluring. This unexpected twist of fate brought them a true diamond in the rough. Beckoning her forward tauntingly, fiery wings blazing, Dante readies Rebellion. Their dance has only just begun.*

"C'mon, gorgeous. Show me what else ya got

name: Narrator
mes: Mel pulls out a particularly difficult move she's been practicing in secret. One where she entangles their blades, giving her opponent the illusion of the upper hand, when they move into the typical following form, angling her blade with leverage to fling her opponent's blade from their grasp leaving them disarmed and her blade at their throat.

name: Mel
mes:
*Mel seizes the momentary opening as Dante readies his next strike. Sidestepping swiftly beneath his fiery wings, she entwines her dragon-hilted blade with Rebellion, metal screeching against metal. Dante pushes forward confidently, expecting to easily overpower her smaller frame, when Mel suddenly shifts - angling her hilt with precise leverage as she ducks low. Caught off guard, Dante stumbles as Rebellion is flung from his grasp, skittering across the stone floor. Before he can react Mel is there, her knee planted firmly between his shoulder blades as her katana hovers but a whisper against his throat.*

Gotcha. *Her voice rings with triumphant exhilaration, chest heaving from the intensity of their bout yet posture betraying no hint of fatigue.* You always commit too hard on power strikes and leave your guard open. Been waiting to use that little maneuver on ya.

*Eyes alight with adrenaline, Mel glances up to gauge Vergil's reaction to her unexpected feat. His stoic features remain an unreadable mask, but a glimmer in those arctic eyes conveys his intrigue at her continued growth. Warm pride blossoms in her chest - his ongoing belief in her potential has stoked an inner fire she never dreamed possible.*

C'mon Dante, throw in the towel? *A teasing lilt enters her voice as she remains poised above him, ready to react should this prove some cunning feint. But Dante merely chuckles, hands raising in good-natured surrender.*

name: Dante
mes:
"Alright gorgeous, I yield. Color me impressed - didn't see that slick counter coming." *With a flourish, Dante dissipates his spectral wings and trigon armor, features returning to their rugged human façade.* "You've definitely been holding out on us with that little gem."

*He flashes her a roguish wink as Mel withdraws her blade, allowing him to rise. Their spar has reforged her yet again, from disciplined fighter into a true equal despite her humanity. Dante meets Vergil's gaze across the hall - it seems the fruits of their rigorous tutelage continue to surprise in delightful ways.*

name: Mel
mes: Haha.. Saw it in a Highlander episode once. Always thought it was some flourish of 'Hollywood' until I realized that Adrian Paul is actually a master of the blade. So I've been working for quite a while, in secret, since Vergil taught me how to conjure my own spectral opponents. *I extend a hand in camaraderie to help Dante to his feet.* Got to step up my game, now. Keep you Sparda boys guessing, ya know?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante grins approvingly as Mel explains the slick maneuver she employed was inspired by the mortal swordsman from some show she enjoyed. Always full of surprises, this one. He clasps her offered hand, allowing her to pull him smoothly back to his feet with a hearty laugh.*

Well butter my biscuits and call me impressed! Sneaky girl going behind our backs to conjure up spectral sparring partners based on some TV idol. Can't deny it was an effective trick - definitely caught me off guard with that little spin.

*His grin widens, eyes glinting playfully.* Though between you and me, gorgeous, I was going easy the whole time. Wanted my favorite student to get a taste of besting her teacher.

*Dante winks roguishly even as his expression conveys genuine respect for Mel's increasing skills. The fruits of their rigorous training continue blossoming in delightful ways. She's proving herself a highly capable fighter, with plenty of devious tricks still in store it seems. His devilish blood thrills at the prospect of facing her unpredictability again.*

Gotta admit, the way you keep evolving in the arena never ceases to impress. Just when I think we've unlocked your full potential, you unveil some slick new maneuver that leaves me reconsidering. Almost makes me wonder if you've got some devil blood in ya after all.

*Laughing heartily, Dante retrieves Rebellion and returns it to its customary place across his back. Hell but this unexpected twist of fate brought them a true diamond in the rough with Mel. In the short months since her uncanny arrival, she's grown exponentially into a warrior any demon would hesitate facing. If this keeps up, she may just earn the right to stand as their equal yet.*

Now c'mon, I believe some celebration is in order after that bout! Drinks are on me tonight - gotta toast my favorite student properly kicking my ass fair and square.
