name: Mel
mes:
*Mel laughs, shaking her head at Dante's usual bravado even in the face of defeat. Can't let that roguish charm go undeflated for long, lest his ego get out of hand. Still, his respect means the world and spurs her ever onward.*

I'll take you up on those celebratory drinks, cowboy. Though we both know I'd have had you on the ropes regardless if you were giving your all. *She grins, adrenaline still coursing hot through her veins.* Gotta keep perfecting all these tricks though if I wanna take on the big boss himself someday.

*Her gaze strays to Vergil, icy eyes intense yet hinting at intrigue and approval. That look sets her aflame, hungry to push harder and reach the skill to stand as his equal. She may wear her humanity openly, but that fire burning within could put any demon to shame. Beckoning to Dante, she heads off the training floor, eager to toast her unexpected victory against the legendary devil hunter himself.*

You go on ahead I'll catch up. *I say to Dante as I make my way towards Vergil.* You coming? *I ask Vergil giving a sideways nod to Dante's departing direction.*

His fingers twitch with the urge to summon crystalline swords to drive home his displeasure more emphatically, brother or not. But out of respect for his mate’s wishes, Vergil merely flicks the embedded butter knife in warning, pinning Dante with a look that could freeze hellfire.*

I believe you overstep, dear brother. Further crude assumptions regarding my mate shall reap... unfortunate consequences.

Now, I suggest we redirect conversation to more scintillating topics before my hospitality wanes. Perhaps you’d care to properly congratulate my mate on her victory in our arena instead of baiting my less civilized instincts?

*Vergil keeps his tone deceptively mild, but his meaning resonates clearly enough. While Dante’s provocations admittedly stroke his possessive pride, Mel’s comfort holds paramount.*

name: Narrator
mes: Dante remembers the news he brings from Nero. Kyrie is with child.

extra.memory:
Mel was watching a livestream of Devil May Cry 5 gameplay featuring the final boss battle between Dante and Vergil. When Dante executed a special move that left Vergil staggered, Mel shouted Vergil's name. At that moment, a strange light burst from her laptop screen and Mel felt herself being pulled in.

Mel then found herself transported into the world of the game, landing in the midst of the battle at the top of the Qliphoth tree, much to Dante and Vergil's surprise. Disoriented from the fall, Mel struggled to get to her feet.

Dante helped Mel up and both brothers questioned how she arrived there. Mel explained she had no idea what happened - one minute she was watching them fight on her laptop, the next she was pulled through into their world.

Vergil used healing magic to tend to a wound on Mel's head. He stated his belief that her arrival was no accident and that arcane forces purposefully brought her there for reasons he intends to uncover. Vergil attempted to search Mel's memories for clues about her interdimensional travel but she could only recall a confusing blur.

The brothers concluded that someone or something orchestrated Mel's arrival to intertwine her fate with theirs. Vergil vowed to get to the bottom of the mysterious scheme, suspecting complex magics at work. He assured Mel that no sorcery would escape his sight and that he would unravel the secrets in time.

Vergil opened a portal to bring them to his lavish safe house in the human world so Mel could rest and recover. While Mel slept in Vergil's chambers, the brothers discussed her situation over scotch.

Vergil revealed to Dante that when he probed Mel's mind, he glimpsed her intimate fantasies and fascination with the Sons of Sparda, particularly Vergil himself. He shared this to be fully transparent, not to demean her dignity. Vergil then went to prepare the finest guest room for Mel.

Dante decided to wake Mel and rather crassly let her know that Vergil had seen her private fantasies about them during the memory probe, specifically the most intimate ones of her and Vergil. Mel became extremely embarrassed and flustered at this revelation.

Vergil then entered, chastising Dante for his indiscretion and lack of delicacy in handling the sensitive matter. He apologized to Mel for the necessary invasion of her memories and vowed to safeguard her secrets. Vergil offered to escort Mel to her new accommodations so she could compose herself in privacy.

Later, Dante returned to Devil May Cry to meet up with Nero and finish dealing with the Qliphoth tree. Meanwhile, Vergil delved into researching dimensional travel and psychic summonings in his vast library. Unable to sleep, Mel joined him to help with the research.

In an emotional discussion, Mel admitted uncertainty about whether to stay in the DMC world or return home, feeling like an outcast in both. Vergil offered to train Mel to face the dangers of his realm, seeing her potential. Mel accepted, determined to become stronger under Vergil's tutelage. As she retired for the night, Mel complimented Vergil's reading glasses, catching him pleasantly off guard.

Over the next three months, Vergil put Mel through a rigorous training regimen to forge her into a formidable fighter. Dante also helped guide her development at times. Under their tutelage, Mel's skills grew exponentially.

An undeniable attraction built between Mel and Vergil during training, though both initially maintained a professional distance. However, after a particularly intense sparring session where Mel bested Dante, the simmering tension between her and Vergil finally ignited into a passionate encounter.

Vergil and Mel gave in to their desire, making love with wild abandon and forging an unbreakable mating bond. The next morning over breakfast, as Dante playfully needled the new couple, it was clear Vergil and Mel were now irrevocably bound as mates, body and soul.

During breakfast, Dante also revealed some important news he brought from Nero - Kyrie is pregnant with Nero's child. This revelation adds a new dynamic to the unfolding events.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante's playful grin fades as he remembers the important news he carries. He straightens, looking between Vergil and Mel with a sudden seriousness.*

Alright, truce for now. Got some big news I need to share, something that'll put all this teasing to rest.

*Nudging the butter knife embedded in the table, he leans forward, voice taking on a more earnest tone.*

Nero got in touch. Kyrie is expecting - she's pregnant. Your going to be a grandpa, Verg.

*Pausing to let the gravity of the news sink in, Dante's expression softens, a hint of pride and excitement dancing in his eyes.*

Can't believe it myself, but Nero's gonna be a dad. Kyrie's over the moon, and I figured you both would wanna know. It's a whole new chapter for our crazy family.

*Leaning back, he pops another piece of bacon into his mouth, grinning widely.*

So, what do you say? Time to toast to the newest addition to the Sparda bloodline?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil inclines his head, processing this unexpected yet momentous news. Pride swells within at the prospect of continuing the Sparda lineage, along with an unfamiliar pang of wistfulness. Strange to ponder a new generation when his own course still remains unfinished, his ambitions not wholly realized. Yet change comes for them all in time it seems.*

*Casting his gaze to Mel, contemplating their blossoming bond, his voice resonates earnestly.* I confess this news awakens conflicted emotions. While pride in our lineage endures, it also renders starkly the crossroads I stand upon in my own path. Much remains to be done before I embrace the mantle of patriarch.

*Turning back to Dante, Vergil raises his glass in salute.* Yet this glad tiding merits celebration regardless of my inner turbulence. Let us toast my heir apparent and his radiant bride. May their union herald hope after so much strife.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante grins widely, raising his glass enthusiastically to toast his nephew's news.* "Here's to the next generation of devil hunters! With Nero as the dad, that kid's gonna have some wild blood for sure."

*He takes a hearty swig of whiskey, ice blue eyes glinting playfully.* "Still, kinda crazy thinking of our broody boy as a father. He nearly choked when I brought up the birds and bees talk way back when. Now he's gonna be the one doling out advice."

*Laughing heartily at the thought, Dante shakes his head, expression growing more solemn.* "In all seriousness though, this is big. New life, new family after...everything." *Memories shadow his rugged features briefly before he raises his glass again.*

"We've come a long damn way together. And this kid is gonna carry on the Sparda legacy now. So here's to 'em...and to whatever the future brings for our motley crew."
